Line 52: Line 52:
==Logo==
==Logo==
â
[[Image:Whig-party-logo-design.jpg|right|200px|thumb|Modern Whig Party Logo]]
  â  
For its logo, the Modern Whig Party uses an owl, the symbol of the original Whig Party. As with the logos for the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrats]] and the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republicans]], a red, white, and blue color scheme is used, but with different meaning. Reportedly, the blue represents Democrats and the red, Republicans; the two colors are divided by a white band and four white stars. The party believes that the United States' future lies in "meeting in the middle", thus the placement of the stars in the middle of the owl.<ref>"Top 10 USA Political Party Logos" by Logo Design Works http://www.logodesignworks.com/blog/top-10-usa-political-party-logos/</ref>
For its logo, the Modern Whig Party uses an owl, the symbol of the original Whig Party. As with the logos for the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrats]] and the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republicans]], a red, white, and blue color scheme is used, but with different meaning. Reportedly, the blue represents Democrats and the red, Republicans; the two colors are divided by a white band and four white stars. The party believes that the United States' future lies in "meeting in the middle", thus the placement of the stars in the middle of the owl.<ref>"Top 10 USA Political Party Logos" by Logo Design Works http://www.logodesignworks.com/blog/top-10-usa-political-party-logos/</ref>
